item.title: Rishi Sunak: Strikes on Houthis intended as 'limited, single action'
item.content:encoded: <div> But the prime minister says the UK "will not hesitate to protect our security" following Houthi attacks on shipping. <div> But the prime minister says the UK "will not hesitate to protect our security" following Houthi attacks on shipping.

item.title: I am determined to pass Rwanda bill, says Rishi Sunak
item.content:encoded: <div> More than 50 Conservative MPs are backing changes to the bill, which will be debated by MPs on Tuesday. <div> More than 50 Conservative MPs are backing changes to the bill, which will be debated by MPs on Tuesday.

item.title: Home Office to ban Hizb ut-Tahrir as terror group
item.content:encoded: <div> The controversial Islamist group is accused of praising the Hamas attacks on Israel. <div> The controversial Islamist group is accused of praising the Hamas attacks on Israel.

item.title: Stormont crisis: Decisions to make if Stormont not restored - SoS
item.content:encoded: <div> Chris Heaton-Harris holds further meetings with Stormont parties, but there is still no deal. <div> Chris Heaton-Harris holds further meetings with Stormont parties, but there is still no deal.

item.title: Pothole reports hit a five-year high in 2023
item.content:encoded: <div> Climate change will worsen potholes but scientists hope new technology will help make them a thing of the past. <div> Climate change will worsen potholes but scientists hope new technology will help make them a thing of the past.

item.title: Starmer denies backtracking on military action vote
item.content:encoded: <div> While running to be Labour leader, Sir Keir promised a law requiring a Commons vote for military action. <div> While running to be Labour leader, Sir Keir promised a law requiring a Commons vote for military action.

item.title: UK will back words with actions against Houthis in Yemen - Cameron
item.content:encoded: <div> The foreign secretary says the air strikes were necessary after Houthis attacks on ships in the Red Sea. <div> The foreign secretary says the air strikes were necessary after Houthis attacks on ships in the Red Sea.

item.title: Stephen Flynn fears 'wider regional crisis' after Yemen air strikes
item.content:encoded: <div> SNP Westminster leader Stephen Flynn also says the failure to consult MPs in advance was "farcical". <div> SNP Westminster leader Stephen Flynn also says the failure to consult MPs in advance was "farcical".

item.title: Post Office scandal: Minister says he wants to see those responsible jailed
item.content:encoded: Kevin Hollinrake said that people "must be held to account" over the scandal.

item.title: David Cameron denies £10m payment from Greensill Capital
item.content:encoded: The foreign secretary says he was a "private citizen" while working for the collapsed finance firm.

item.title: Tony Blair was warned Horizon IT system could be flawed, documents show
item.content:encoded: The then-PM was told IT system now at the centre of the Post Office scandal was "possibly unreliable".

item.title: Thousands attend pro-Palestinian march in London
item.content:encoded: Organisers say the protest was part of a global day of action in 30 countries.

item.title: New Malden ex-postmistress aims to stand against Sir Ed Davey
item.content:encoded: Yvonne Tracey says she will contest the Lib Dem leader's seat at the next general election.

item.title: Sunak vows that Ukraine will never be alone as he pledges £2.5bn package
item.content:encoded: Rishi Sunak announces the package, the largest since Russia's invasion, on a surprise trip to Kyiv.

item.title: Fujitsu won Foreign Office contract despite concerns
item.content:encoded: The firm at the heart of the Post Office IT scandal is in the spotlight over government contracts.

item.title: Tory MPs pile further pressure on Rishi Sunak over Rwanda bill
item.content:encoded: Former Home Secretary Suella Braverman warns she will vote against it unless it is strengthened.

item.title: UK and US strikes on Houthi sites in Yemen are self-defence, says Rishi Sunak
item.content:encoded: Rishi Sunak says the action against the Iranian-backed group is "necessary and proportionate".

item.title: Rishi Sunak faces call for MP vote on Houthi air strike
item.content:encoded: Downing Street briefed Sir Keir Starmer but held no vote before the RAF bombed military bases in Yemen.

item.title: Sunak authorises Labour and civil service talks ahead of election
item.content:encoded: The meetings enable the opposition to establish relationships with Whitehall ahead of an election.

item.title: Government defends spending £27,000 on wine during Covid
item.content:encoded: The alcohol, stored in a basement in central London, is provided to government guests.

item.title: I'm up for fight over nanny state accusations, says Keir Starmer
item.content:encoded: Labour wants to bring in supervised toothbrushing in schools and restrict junk food adverts.

item.title: Keir Starmer used Qatar-funded private jet for Emir trip
item.content:encoded: The Labour leader made the return trip whilst attending the COP28 climate conference held in Dubai.

item.title: Government announces by-elections in two Tory-held constituencies
item.content:encoded: Voters will go the polls in Wellingborough and Kingswood on Thursday, 15 February.

item.title: I didn't know about Horizon prosecutions, says Keir Starmer
item.content:encoded: The Labour leader says the Crown Prosecution Service he led handled a total of four million cases.

item.title: UK economic growth rebounds in November
item.content:encoded: Black Friday deals boosted shops and the economy, figures show, but the risk of recession remains.

item.title: HS2 northern leg 'not possible to do' says Sir Keir Starmer
item.content:encoded: Sir Keir says Labour will not revive the northern leg of HS2 if the party wins the general election.

item.title: Minister Alex Burghart seeks to avoid outsourcing AI projects to tech firms
item.content:encoded: Cabinet Office minister Alex Burghart says he wants build up the government's in-house expertise instead.

item.title: Lib Dems urge Ofcom to investigate GB News Post Office scandal coverage
item.content:encoded: The party complains to regulator Ofcom about alleged bias in coverage of the Post Office IT scandal.

item.title: Labour MP Tony Lloyd reveals he has untreatable leukaemia
item.content:encoded: Rochdale's Labour MP Tony Lloyd says he intends to "spend the time I have left with my family".

item.title: PM: Yemen action was taken in self-defence
item.content:encoded: Rishi Sunak says that UK strikes on Houthi military targets in Yemen were "in self-defence".

item.title: Starmer condemns Houthi attacks and backs UK strikes
item.content:encoded: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer reiterates that his party backs the "targeted" action in the Red Sea.

item.title: Cameron says Houthis are escalating tensions in Middle East
item.content:encoded: The foreign secretary says the UK and its allies had little choice to act against attacks on commercial vessels.

item.title: Starmer backs strikes to stop Houthi attacks
item.content:encoded: Sir Keir Starmer says Labour backs the military operation to stop Houthi attacks in the Red Sea.

item.title: Cameron refuses to confirm Greensill pay
item.content:encoded: He has was asked by Laura Kuenssberg to confirm how much money he was paid by Greensill Capital when he left politics.

item.title: General election: When is the next one and who decides?
item.content:encoded: A UK general election has to be held by 28 January 2025, but could take place earlier.
